t: Matthew 9
Jesus Forgives and Heals a Paralyzed Man
Jesus*p stepped into a boat, crossed over and came to his own town.
Some men brought to him a paralyzed man, lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the man, “Take*r heart,*r son;*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven.”*r
At*p this, some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, “This fellow is blaspheming!”
Knowing*p their thoughts, Jesus said, “Why*r do*r you*r entertain*r evil*r thoughts*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier:*r to*r say,*r ‘Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Get*r up*r and*r walk’?*r

But*r I*r want*r you*r to*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r authority*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins.”*r So he said to the paralyzed man, “Get*r up,*r take*r your*r mat*r and*r go*r home.”*r
Then the man got up and went home.
When the crowd saw this, they were filled with awe; and they praised God, who had given such authority to man.
The Calling of Matthew
As*p Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s booth. “Follow*r me,”*r he told him, and Matthew got up and followed him.
While*p Jesus was having dinner at Matthew’s house, many tax collectors and sinners came and ate with him and his disciples.
When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
On*p hearing this, Jesus said, “It*r is*r not*r the*r healthy*r who*r need*r a*r doctor,*r but*r the*r sick.*r
But*r go*r and*r learn*r what*r this*r means:*r ‘I*r desire*r mercy,*r not*r sacrifice.’*r For*r I*r have*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners.”*r
Jesus Questioned About Fasting
Then*p John’s disciples came and asked him, “How is it that we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”

Jesus*p answered, “How*r can*r the*r guests*r of*r the*r bridegroom*r mourn*r while*r he*r is*r with*r them?*r The*r time*r will*r come*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r will*r be*r taken*r from*r them;*r then*r they*r will*r fast.*r
“No*rp one*r sews*r a*r patch*r of*r unshrunk*r cloth*r on*r an*r old*r garment,*r for*r the*r patch*r will*r pull*r away*r from*r the*r garment,*r making*r the*r tear*r worse.*r

Neither*r do*r people*r pour*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins.*r If*r they*r do,*r the*r skins*r will*r burst;*r the*r wine*r will*r run*r out*r and*r the*r wineskins*r will*r be*r ruined.*r No,*r they*r pour*r new*r wine*r into*r new*r wineskins,*r and*r both*r are*r preserved.”*r
Jesus Raises a Dead Girl and Heals a Sick Woman
While*p he was saying this, a synagogue leader came and knelt before him and said, “My daughter has just died. But come and put your hand on her, and she will live.”
Jesus got up and went with him, and so did his disciples.
Just*p then a woman who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak.
She said to herself, “If I only touch his cloak, I will be healed.”
Jesus*p turned and saw her. “Take*r heart,*r daughter,”*r he said, “your*r faith*r has*r healed*r you.”*r And the woman was healed at that moment.
When*p Jesus entered the synagogue leader’s house and saw the noisy crowd and people playing pipes,
he said, “Go*r away.*r The*r girl*r is*r not*r dead*r but*r asleep.”*r But they laughed at him.
After the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.
News of this spread through all that region.
Jesus Heals the Blind and the Mute
As*p Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
When*p he had gone indoors, the blind men came to him, and he asked them, “Do*r you*r believe*r that*r I*r am*r able*r to*r do*r this?”*r “Yes,*p Lord,” they replied.
Then*p he touched their eyes and said, “According*r to*r your*r faith*r let*r it*r be*r done*r to*r you”;*r
and their sight was restored. Jesus warned them sternly, “See*r that*r no*r one*r knows*r about*r this.”*r
But they went out and spread the news about him all over that region.
While*p they were going out, a man who was demon-possessed and could not talk was brought to Jesus.
And when the demon was driven out, the man who had been mute spoke. The crowd was amazed and said, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”
But*p the Pharisees said, “It is by the prince of demons that he drives out demons.”
The Workers Are Few
Jesus*p went through all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and sickness.
When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
Then he said to his disciples, “The*r harvest*r is*r plentiful*r but*r the*r workers*r are*r few.*r
Ask*r the*r Lord*r of*r the*r harvest,*r therefore,*r to*r send*r out*r workers*r into*r his*r harvest*r field.”*r
